lines.line_text: HUSH! my dear, lie still and slumber,
Holy Angels guard thy Bed!
Heav'nly Blessings without Number
Gently falling on thy Head.

stanzas.stanza_text:
HUSH! my dear, lie still and slumber,
Holy Angels guard thy Bed!
Heav'nly Blessings without Number
Gently falling on thy Head.

lines.line_text: Sleep, my Babe; thy Food and Raiment,
House and Home thy Friends provide;
All without thy Care or Payment,
All thy Wants are well supply'd.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Sleep, my Babe; thy Food and Raiment,
House and Home thy Friends provide;
All without thy Care or Payment,
All thy Wants are well supply'd.

lines.line_text: How much better thou'rt attended
Than the SON of GOD could be;
When from Heav'n he descended,
And became a Child like thee?

stanzas.stanza_text:
How much better thou'rt attended
Than the SON of GOD could be;
When from Heav'n he descended,
And became a Child like thee?

lines.line_text: Soft and easy is thy Cradle:
Coarse and hard thy Saviour lay;
When his Birth-place was a Stable,
And his softest Bed was Hay.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Soft and easy is thy Cradle:
Coarse and hard thy Saviour lay;
When his Birth-place was a Stable,
And his softest Bed was Hay.

lines.line_text: Blessed Babe! what glorious Features,
Spotless fair, divinely bright!
Must he dwell with brutal Creatures!
How could Angels bear the Sight?

stanzas.stanza_text:
Blessed Babe! what glorious Features,
Spotless fair, divinely bright!
Must he dwell with brutal Creatures!
How could Angels bear the Sight?

lines.line_text: Was there nothing but a Manger
Cursed Sinners could afford,
To receive the heavenly Stranger!
Did they thus affront their LORD?

stanzas.stanza_text:
Was there nothing but a Manger
Cursed Sinners could afford,
To receive the heavenly Stranger!
Did they thus affront their LORD?

lines.line_text: Soft my Child? I did not chide thee,
Tho' my Song might sound too hard;
'Tis thy Mother / Nurse that sits beside thee,
And her Arms shall be thy Guard.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Soft my Child? I did not chide thee,
Tho' my Song might sound too hard;
'Tis thy Mother / Nurse that sits beside thee,
And her Arms shall be thy Guard.

lines.line_text: Yet to read the shameful Story,
How the Jews abus'd their King,
How they serv'd the LORD of Glory,
Makes me angry while I sing.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Yet to read the shameful Story,
How the Jews abus'd their King,
How they serv'd the LORD of Glory,
Makes me angry while I sing.

lines.line_text: See the kinder Shepherds round him,
Telling Wonders from the Sky!
Where they sought him, there they found him,
With his Virgin Mother by.

stanzas.stanza_text:
See the kinder Shepherds round him,
Telling Wonders from the Sky!
Where they sought him, there they found him,
With his Virgin Mother by.

lines.line_text: See the lovely Babe a-dressing;
Lovely Infant, how he smil'd!
When he wept, the Mother's Blessing
Sooth'd and hush'd the holy Child.

stanzas.stanza_text:
See the lovely Babe a-dressing;
Lovely Infant, how he smil'd!
When he wept, the Mother's Blessing
Sooth'd and hush'd the holy Child.

lines.line_text: Lo, he slumbers in his Manger,
Where the horned Oxen fed;
Peace, my Darling, here's no Danger,
Here's no Ox a-near thy Bed.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Lo, he slumbers in his Manger,
Where the horned Oxen fed;
Peace, my Darling, here's no Danger,
Here's no Ox a-near thy Bed.

lines.line_text: 'Twas to save Thee, Child, from dying,
Save my Dear from burning Flame,
Bitter Grones and endless Crying,
That thy blest Redeemer came.

stanzas.stanza_text:
'Twas to save Thee, Child, from dying,
Save my Dear from burning Flame,
Bitter Grones and endless Crying,
That thy blest Redeemer came.

lines.line_text: May'st thou live to know and fear Him,
Trust and love him all thy Days;
Then go dwell for ever near Him,
See his Face, and sing his Praise?

stanzas.stanza_text:
May'st thou live to know and fear Him,
Trust and love him all thy Days;
Then go dwell for ever near Him,
See his Face, and sing his Praise?

lines.line_text: I could give thee thousand Kisses,
Hoping what I most desire;
Not a Mother's fondest Wishes
Can to greater Joys aspire.

stanzas.stanza_text:
I could give thee thousand Kisses,
Hoping what I most desire;
Not a Mother's fondest Wishes
Can to greater Joys aspire.
